title: Death Eye
html:
Death Eye

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
e Death Eye (No tile)
Difficulty 20
Attacks gaze 4d6 random, gaze 4d6 paralyze, gaze 4d6 deadly, passive gaze 3d5 paralyze
e Death Eye (No tile)
Difficulty 20
Attacks

gaze 4d6 random, gaze 4d6 paralyze, gaze 4d6 deadly, passive gaze 3d5 paralyze

Base level 15
Base experience 480
Speed 8
Base AC 4
Base MR 50
Alignment -10 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 9000
Nutritional value 800
Size large
Resistances cold, sleep, shock, poison, petrification

The Death Eye:

  • can fly.
  • can survive underwater.
  • does not breathe.
  • has no hands.
  • has no limbs.
  • has no head.
  • can see invisible creatures.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • cannot be tamed.

The Death Eye, e, is a unique monster that appears in notdNetHack. It is a large eye creature that is a more powerful form of beholder. The Death Eye is amphibious, capable of flight, has infravision, and can be seen via infravision.

The Death Eye has a passive gaze attack that paralyzes the attacker, an active gaze attack that also paralyzes, another active gaze that can have deadly effects, and a third gaze that uses one of 16 random damage types: death magic, cancellation, paralysis, drain life, disenchantment, gradual stoning, luck-draining, confusion, slowing, stunning, blinding, fire, cold, shock, hallucination, and sleep - fire, cold and shock gazes each have a 2⁄19 chance of being selected per attack, while the other damage types each have a 1⁄19 chance of being selected. The Death Eye possesses fire resistance, cold resistance, shock resistance, poison resistance, and stoning resistance.

The Death Eye is poisonous to eat, which primarily comes up if it is digested by another monster.

Generation

The Death Eye is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for polymorph.

The Death Eye is always generated on the first Nightmare Temple floor of the Chaos Temple Quest at level creation.

The Death Eye does not leave a corpse upon death.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

The '''Death Eye''', {{magenta|e}}, is a unique [[monster]] that appears in [[notdNetHack]]. It is a [[large]] [[Eye or sphere|eye]] creature that is a more powerful form of [[Beholder (dNetHack)|beholder]]. The Death Eye is [[amphibious]], capable of [[flight]], has [[infravision]], and can be seen via infravision.

The Death Eye has a passive gaze attack that [[paralyze]]s the attacker, an active [[gaze attack]] that also paralyzes, another active gaze that can have deadly effects, and a third gaze that uses one of 16 random [[damage type]]s: [[death magic]], [[cancellation]], paralysis, [[drain life]], [[AD_ENCH|disenchantment]], gradual [[stoning]], [[luck]]-draining, [[confusion]], [[slowing]], [[stunning]], [[blind]]ing, [[fire]], [[cold]], [[shock]], [[hallucination]], and [[sleep]] - fire, cold and shock gazes each have a {{frac|2|19}} chance of being selected per attack, while the other damage types each have a {{frac|19}} chance of being selected. The Death Eye possesses [[fire resistance]], [[cold resistance]], [[shock resistance]], [[poison resistance]], and [[stoning resistance]].

The Death Eye is [[poisonous]] to eat, which primarily comes up if it is [[digest]]ed by another monster.

==Generation==
The Death Eye is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for [[polymorph]].

The Death Eye is always generated on the first Nightmare Temple floor of the [[Chaos Temple Quest]] at level creation.

The Death Eye [[Corpseless|does not leave a corpse]] upon death.
